data.title: Hit or miss
data.text:
The first time I ate at Blue Moon, I had a great time. My boyfriend and I went for dinner and both enjoyed ourselves. The food was good, the live music was so fun, and our waitress was so nice. We were both excited to have a found a great locals spot.

After my second time eating at Blue Moon, I swore I would never return and I haven't. I ate with two work colleagues and I don't think either of them have been back either. The food was mediocre and the service was awful. We arrived at 12:45PM for lunch and consistently felt like the waitress was trying to get us to leave. We ordered beignets after our meal and the waitress actually started collecting our plates while we still had food on them. At exactly 2PM, she even shut the music off on us! Incredibly rude, especially considering that we seemed to be the only customers they had that day.

If the waitress had come and thanked us for our business and told us the restaurant was closing, we wouldn't have had any issue. It was the rude and abrupt way we were kicked out that bothered the most. I'm happy to take my money elsewhere.

data.title: Outstanding Small Restaurant
data.text: I really have to admit. I saw an ad in the local newspaper about a Mother's Day Special meal and took my wife on the Friday night before the holiday. My wife ordered the special Seafood Manicotti and I ordered the Fried Shrimp. Wow! Both were outstanding. My shrimp was cooked to perfection with a base of grits that was mixed with an outstanding and tasty sauce. We also had a salad, good French bread, a small jambalaya in a cup and the waitress topped it off with a nice plate of four beignets that were steaming hot. What an excellent meal? It was great and not that expensive. I highly recommend this small bistro Cajun themed restaurant for any type of meal. You will be pleased as everything is high quality and tasty. The service was also outstanding and very attentive. Do not miss this small place on South Foster Street in Dothan. Forget all those franchised restaurants with those microwaved meals. Try this one and you will not be disappointed. It is excellent also for lunch.

data.title: Country Cooking
data.text: Had the Buttermilk Friend Chicken, Mashed potatoes with gravy and green beans. Like home cooking and the potatoes were real, not instant.

data.title: Go When Truly Hungry
data.text: While I have enjoyed this tiny, yet terrific café just once, I will revisit as soon as my schedule allows. Their etouffee left me wishing I could return much more quickly. The environment is definitely eclectic with all sorts of signage and comfortable, yet rustic furnishings. I also intend to return to sample some of the beer they offer. Everything is homemade, and the staff is welcoming and helpful. Be sure to check their hours of operation.

data.title: great place to get some etouffe and and po boy in wiregrass
data.text: Stopped in for lunch today with the family.  We had the shrimp etouffe, she crab soup, chicken gumbo,  oyster poboy, catfish poboy and the meatball po boy. Food was very good and hit the spot on a rainy day in Dothan.  Location is unique and adds a unique experience you find elsewhere in Dothan.

data.title: The BEST Food!! Service could use help.
data.text: The only reason I'm giving 3 stars is because the food is FABULOUS!! The service on the other hand was another story. My group of friends and I waited 1 hour to get drinks and then waited an additional 1.5 hours to get our food. Insane. The only reason we stayed is because of the food. Their cheese grits are AMAZING!! I just wish I had a better experience.

data.title: Good, inexpensive lunch
data.text: In town for business, first visit to Dothan. Blue Moon is a cool little place with unique decor in the downtown area.  Had the lunch special which is half of any po-boy and a cup of any soup (except for the seafood gumbo which is more expensive).  Had the muffaleta and chicken/sausage gumbo.  Have had better bread on a muffaletta but the olive salad on it was good.  The gumbo had a fair amount of meat in it and just the right amount of spice for my taste.  This and a drink was under $10.  Other reviews say their weekend dinner is very good.  Based on this lunch trip, I'd like to try the dinner.

data.title: Don't go here!
data.text: DISAPPOINTING! Service was SO slow, out of everything and served the food COLD! To solve the problem they microwaved it which left our frozen seafood rubbery and inedible. We used to be faithful customers but this business has gone down considerably in the past few years. We had a birthday for my husband there and it took 2.5 hours to get our food! We only had a party of 8! The last few visits have been a complete let down!!! If you take the risk to eat at this business, make sure you don't go in with more than 4 tables. Otherwise, you'll be in there for an hour and a half. More troubling, however, is their food. What used to be our favorite restaurant in Dothan is little more than Long John Silvers with decent beer. Blue Moon Cafe has been mentioned in several conversations with friends and acquaintances with all the same negative results. Good luck, Blue Moon Cafe! You need all the help you can get.

data.title: Always delicious
data.text: I love eating at blue moon. It reminds me of the French quarter. The food is great and the service is too. The cheesy tomato grits served at dinner only are to die for. I always go for the special, you can be sure Jana came up with something delicious.

data.title: If I can't get to Nawlins then I'm glad I'm here!
data.text: Been to the Blue Moon Cafe a couple of times. We always enjoy the music and atmosphere. The food is really as good as any in New Orleans! We always look forward to reading the chefs special in the local paper. It's a real Nawlins flavor.

data.title: Great food, nice embiance, very hard to locate
data.text:
I came here because my date (who is from a small town near Dothan) recommended it. I only found the place because I looked it up on the internet and knew exactly where it was. We arrived on Saturday night about 5:00... there were no visible lights, no cars parked near the place, the outside sign is all but invisible... I never would have even gone in if we hadn't planned on eating here. We were able to park right in front of the door. 

There were two other customers in the place, both siting at the bar having drinks. The waitress was very prompt and it turns out she knew my date, who is a teacher at a small town high school nearby. The waitress told us about the nightly special, a fabulous stuffed grouper sautéed and served over dirty rice and toped with a white sauce full of crawfish and crabmeat. It was magnificent. My date had the shrimp etoufee, which she enjoyed as much as I did my grouper. 

The food was excellent, the service very friendly (of course, she knew one of us) and the overall experience very nice. I found the menu with the exception of the special to be a bit lacking in choices... mostly burgers, sandwiches, soups and salads, but the Friday night seafood event is what will bring me back again. Every Friday, they have a seafood meal that is amazing, the best looking thing on the menu. 

The grouper was extremely spicy; okay for me, but might have been a bit too spicy for a lot of people who are not fond of Cajun cooking. To quote Emeril Legasse, it was definitely "kicked up a notch"... the menu listed several desserts that sounded fabulous, but we were both too full to order dessert.

The only drawback was the price of the special... it was $25.99, which is pretty pricey for a small town like Dothan... with the special though, the entire bill was only about $42 tax and drinks included.

data.title: Solid Lunch Place- Cajun Food
data.text: I love the Blue Moon for meeting clients or taking out of towers to lunch, because every time I go I know it will be a good, quality meal that is hot, fresh and tastes good. The decor is cute, the service personable and good (and usually fast, but remember there's one server and if the place is packed it will be slower than if there's only a couple tables). I rotate between the 1/2 Shrimp Po Boy sandwich with the She Crab soup and the Muffelata with sweet potato fries, but occasionally enjoy the gumbo or a burger. Consistently good food in a great downtown location keeps me coming back.

data.title: Nice For Something Different
data.text: This restaurant looks like a hole in the wall, but it has a bit of atmosphere.  One wall is covered with a mural of a bayou so it gives the Louisiana feel.  My daughter shared the Cajun Chicken Pasta.  Is was good, but not outstanding.  It was a lot, so easy to share with someone.  I also ordered a cup of Shrimp Ettouffee.  It tasted a bit shrimpy, but I really enjoyed it.  It was loaded with shrimp.  My son tried one of the soups and really enjoyed it.  My daughter's fiance' tried a sandwich and said it was very good.  We also got an order of Beignets.  They were very yummy.  It's not a fancy place, but it had a bit of atmospere and the food was good enough that I will return next time I am in Dothan.  According to another website, they only serve lunch and/or dinner on certain days so call first so you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Second Time Not The Charm
data.text: Service was really poor. Gumbo was as previous reviewer said: Like it was made from a mix? Tasted of too much thyme to me. Was really thick as if the roux was undercooked or was thickened with corn starch. OK so some of you like New Orleans style. I am from NO and this gumbo would not make it there. Gumbo is what you want and expect it to be but in my NO it is a soup with stuff in it rather than a stew. Was also a little hot but that is what some people expect as "Cajun". They seem to have changed bread since my last visit. It could indeed now be from WalMart. Shrimp were OK but coleslaw on a Po Boy. Really? I've had them all over NO and never have I seen or heard of that but since it is not  in the Constitution or Bible it is permissible but one must draw the line somewhere. Imagine shredded carrot or fennel would be OK also but would not be NO style. "Cajun at its' finest", maybe but I don't think so. "Authentic", not in the NO neighborhoods I come from and still return to. Only went here because our friend wanted to try the gumbo since he has tried mine on several occasions. He was only able to eat about 1/3 of his bowl before announcing his as terrible and he is a real honest to goodness sitting legal judge! I rest my case.

data.title: Not Real New Orleans Style Food
data.text: I love NewOrleans style food, this is not it.  I wish it were.  The food is mediocre at best the service is below average and it is overpriced.  My gumbo was cold and the roux tasted like it was made from a mix.

data.title: Authentic
data.text: We have eaten here many times. It is delicious. It reminds me of a little restaurant in New Orleans. My husband is from Louisiana so we had blue moon cater our wedding. It was great! I highly recommend trying this if you like Cajun food.

data.title: Cajun at its finest
data.text: From the gumbo to the red beans and rice to the muffaletta and the po boys, this place rocks! They have live music occasionally and access to a nice bar next door! This place is a must go if you find yourself in downtown Dothan.

data.title: Outstanding food in a small cozy atmosphere.
data.text: On street parking and in an old downtown building this little restaurant has character. This is our third visit and each time we came away well pleased with this place. I ordered the Grouper Acadian and my wife had the shrimp and grits. We ordered the crab stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer. We both agreed these were the best mushroom appetizers we had ever eaten. My dish was well seasoned and perfectly cooked. My wife's dish was also delish. The tomato grits are to die for. They serve gumbo and several kinds of ettoufe, either by the cup or bowl. Their po boys are also good too. They are open for lunch on weekdays and dinner on Thurs. through Sat. nights. Try the beniets for dessert. The prices are also reasonable. They have acoustical soloists on weekend nights for entertainment.
